Third Report on the Temporary Results of the Lepidopteran List of Africa Continent based upon the Info-system of the Cesa stand 1.3.2009 Ahmet Omer Ko^ak Muhabbet Kemal ^ Cesa Projects Diversity of the Lepidoptera in the World (DLW) Lepidoptera of Africa (LAF) Cesa Publications on African Lepidoptera nr. 25 - 2009 Royal Museum for Central Africa Metafro http://www.metafro.be/ ' Prof. Dr. Ahmet Omer Kogak & Asst. Prof. Dr. Muhabbet Kemal, Centre for Entomological Studies Ankara (Cesa): http://www.cesa-tr.org/ 2009 Cesa Publications on African Lepidoptera nr.25 Abstract: Third Report on the Temporary Resuhs of the Lepidoptera List of Africa Continent based upon the Info-system of the Cesa. Cesa Publ. on African Lepid. 25: 1- 2810, figs. maps. This third faunal report on the Lepidoptera of Africa is solely based upon the information of Databank of the Cesa. The comprehensive updated results are reported herewith for the first time. Totally 23261 valid taxa of the species group, living in Africa, are mentioned with valid scientific names, chronologically arranged synonyms and homonyms. Number of the Lepidopteran species recorded in 53 states (or countries) in the Continent Africa are given with previous published information. These are as follows: Algeria [DZ] (1624); Angola [AO] (1119); Benin [BJ] (0122); Botswana [BW] (0382); Burkino-Faso (Upper Volta) [BF] (0119); Burundi [BI] (0287); Cameroon [CM] (2459); Canary Islands [Cn] (0410); Cape de Verde [CV] (0022); Central African Repubhc [CF] (0447); Congo [CG] (0812); Comoros [KM] (0194); Djibouti [DJ] (0123); Egypt [EG] (0696); Equatorial Guinea [GO] (0406); Eritrea [ER] (0205); Ethiopia [ET] (1281); Gabon [GA] (1012); Ghana [GH] (0830); Gambia [GM] (0169); Guinea [GN] (0432); Ivory Coast [CI] (0770); Kenya [KE] (2551); Leshoto [LS] (0159); Liberia [LR] (0413); Libya [LY] (0591); Madagascar [MG] (1500); Malawi [MW] (1107); Mah [ML] (0097); Marocco [MA] (1511); Mauretania [MR] (0187); Mauritius [MU] (0136); Mozambique [MZ] (0977); Namibia [NA] (0532); Niger [NE] (0155); Nigeria [NG] (1709); Reunion [RE] (0099); Rwanda [RW] (0474); Sao Tome [ST] (0204); Senegal [SN] (0388); Sierra Leone [SL] (1044); Sokotra [Sk] (0131); Somalia [SO] (0472); South Africa [ZA] (8474); Sudan [SD] (0839); Swaziland [SZ] (0181); Tanzania [TZ] (2517); Tschad [TD] (0139); Togo [TG] (0259); Tunis [TN] (0985); Uganda [UG] (2497); Zaire [ZR] (3548); Zambia [ZM] (0929); Zimbabwe [ZW] (1648). Besides, the regional faunal lists are also indexed as valid species group taxa. These are as follows: Lepidoptera of Northern Africa, with the 2954 valid species group taxa, Lepidoptera of Western Africa (from Senegal to Cameroon) with the 4544 valid species group taxa, Lepidoptera of Eastern Africa, with the 5376 valid species group taxa, Lepidoptera of African Horn, with the 1578 valid species group taxa, and Lepidoptera of Southern Africa, with the 12879 valid species group taxa. Finally, the valid species group taxa of the Lepidoptera of Africa continent, including Madagascar, Reunion, Comoros, and Mauritius, are indexed as 23261. Synonymous lists of the species and subspecies, recorded in the Continent Africa, had been arranged by the authors using the information of the Databank of the Cesa. For this purpose, totally 22904 valid taxa of species and subspecies in Africa, were listed alphabetically under the related families. In the present report, the Lepidoptera fauna of 53 African states (or country) are evaluated (Fig. 1). Synonymous names are also added to each species in chronological order. Nomenclaturally unavailable names marked with #. Generic names are omitted fort he time being. The numbers of the species group taxa of the states are updated as follows: Algeria [DZ] (1624); Angola [AO] (1119); Benin [BJ] (0122); Botswana [BW] (0382); Burkino-Faso (Upper Volta) [BF] (0119); Burundi [BI] (0287); Cameroon [CM] (2459); Canary Islands [Cn] (0410); Cape de Verde [CV] (0022); Central African Republic [CF] (0447); Congo [CG] (0812); Comoros [KM] (0194); Djibouti [DJ] (0123); Egypt [EG] (0696); Equatorial Guinea [GO] (0406); Eritrea [ER] (0205); Ethiopia [ET] (1281); Gabon [GA] (1012); Ghana [GH] (0830); Gambia [GM] (0169); Guinea [GN] (0432); Ivory Coast [CI] (0770); Kenya [KE] (2551); Leshoto [LS] (0159); Liberia [LR] (0413); Libya [LY] (0591); Madagascar [MG] (1500); Malawi [MW] (1107); Mah [ML] (0097); Marocco [MA] (1511); Mauretania [MR] (0187); Mauritius [MU] (0136); Mozambique [MZ] (0977); Namibia [NA] (0532); Niger [NE] (0155); Nigeria [NG] (1709); Reunion [RE] (0099); Rwanda [RW] (0474); Sao Tome [ST] (0204); Senegal [SN] (0388); Sierra Leone [SL] (1044); Sokotra [Sk] (0131); Somaha [SO] (0472); South Africa [ZA] (8474); Sudan [SD] (0839); Swaziland [SZ] (0181); Tanzania [TZ] (2517); Tschad [TD] (0139); Togo [TG] (0259); Tunis [TN] (0985); Uganda [UG] (2497); Zaire [ZR] (3548); Zambia [ZM] (0929); Zimbabwe [ZW] (1648). Database Programs of the Cesa Since 1998, for the digital information system of the Cesa the Foxpro 2.5 has been used by the authors (see Infosystem of the Cesa http://www.cesa-tr.org/Infos.htm ). There are several database program prepared by the authors themselves. The main file comprises 79 basic fields on the Lepidoptera taxonomy, fauna, morphology, bibliography, distributions, etc.(Figs.2,3). The name of the taxon is used in accordance with the uni-, bi-, and trinominal combinations with the author and date of publication. The synonymous and homonymous names are arranged chronologically. Range of the taxon is explained by special codes (currently more than 6000 geographical codes were produced by the authors). Briefly, 79 specific and worldwide questions can be answered in this database file. Updating, correcting or sorting data according to the alphabetical or taxonomical orders are very easy. Besides, several complementary database files are currently used by the authors.
